input:
Textual context: Bob is big. Bob is green. Dave is kind. Dave is white. Erin is green. Erin is kind. Erin is smart. Fiona is big. Fiona is blue. Fiona is furry. White, blue things are furry. All big, white things are smart. Furry things are green. Kind things are blue. All green things are furry. Green things are big.
Question: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or unknown? Dave is not furry.
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Dave : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Fiona : obj

constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant White : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Smart : obj → Prop

axiom A1 : Big Bob
axiom A2 : Green Bob
axiom A3 : Kind Dave
axiom A4 : White Dave
axiom A5 : Green Erin
axiom A6 : Kind Erin
axiom A7 : Smart Erin
axiom A8 : Big Fiona
axiom A9 : Blue Fiona
axiom A10 : Furry Fiona

-- Rule R1: White and blue things are furry
axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Blue x → Furry x

-- Rule R2: All big, white things are smart
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Big x ∧ White x → Smart x

-- Rule R3: Furry things are green
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Furry x → Green x

-- Rule R4: Kind things are blue
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x → Blue x

-- Rule R5: All green things are furry
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Furry x

-- Rule R6: Green things are big
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Big x

theorem not_furry_Dave : ¬ Furry Dave :=
begin
  have H1 : Kind Dave := A3,
  have H2 : Blue Dave := R4 Dave H1,
  have H3 : White Dave := A4,
  have H4 : Furry Dave := R1 Dave (and.intro H3 H2),
  contradiction,
  sorry,
end

-- Looks like the theorem cannot be proven in Lean.
-- So let's try to prove the negation of the theorem, which is Dave is furry

theorem furry_Dave : Furry Dave :=
begin
  have H1 : Kind Dave := A3,
  have H2 : Blue Dave := R4 Dave H1,
  have H3 : White Dave := A4,
  apply R1 Dave,
  split,
  exact H3,
  exact H2,
end

-- The negation of the theorem can be proven in Lean. So
-- The answer is False
